turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: But, there is one... mitigating factor I want you to consider before you write me off.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Will you think about it?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I don't know. Depends. I'm in a bad mood.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I love you. More than I've ever loved anyone or anything in my life.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I want to spend the rest of my life with you... but I'm not sure you feel the same way.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: ...but first, you have to tell me something...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Anything... just ask.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: What is your name?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: You got off easy.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Will you wait for me?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: We're only talking about six weeks.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Will you be here?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Of course... I haven't got the energy to get out of town that fast.

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: ...so he already had the tattoo that said, "Naomi Forever"... and now they're broken up, see, and he has to have it removed. But while the scar is still healing, or whatever you call it when you have a tattoo removed, he meets Chandra. And it's serious, immediate love. So in no time, he's gone from the most gorgeous model in the world to the most gorgeous actress in North America.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What do you mean, "in no time"?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: In maybe three or four issues.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Weekly or monthly?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: Monthly! God, how shallow do you think Brad is? Why do I waste my time telling you this stuff?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Why do you think you tell me, Nessa?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: Don't do that thing...  ...that shrink thing.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: It's a big part of the show.

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: The school board doesn't pay you? What kind of deal is that?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: It's called pro bono.

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: Pro boner?  Pro bono, huh? For whose good, supposedly?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: It's my bit for the community.

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: Fuck the community.  There was this article my friends and I read. It was "25 Signs He's Great in Bed". It was very fascinating.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Where was this?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: Where?... The New York Times. The first one was -- "he handles produce well." Which we already knew!  The point is, you have a lot of the signs.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You been spying on me in the supermarket, Nessa?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: Have women found you attractive?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: I knew you wouldn't answer. I've been thinking about what you said last time. How me trying to lose weight -- and constantly not -- is like a lot of people with addictions. How maybe I can't lose the weight, ever...  Which we already knew...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: That's not quite what I said --

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: It's a really weird thing for a shrink to say... and then you said maybe people'd be happier if they'd accept that some things don't change -- that it'd be some kind of a relief or something...

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: Isn't she amazing? That is such a wicked look.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What do you want me to see?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: Just chill for a second. Look at this guy, it appears he's actually dead... but gorgeous.

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: What are you doing? We're not done. I just need to find the thing...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: If you don't want to have a session today, it's okay.

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: I want to have the session. I thought it would be cool if I could show you some of the things that interest me. But I guess you're not into it... which we already knew.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What happened today?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Was it something that happened at school?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: These appointments were not my idea, remember.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: True. Should we stop them?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: I don't think you know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: This shrink school you went to... did you hear about it on an infomercial?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: There's this kid at school... Martin Brockett. He has some gigantic idea of himself that no one else shares. You wouldn't believe the crap he lays on me... Who appointed him my spiritual leader? If he has everything so figured out how come his best friend is a .22 rifle? And why's he spend all his time chasing after me? Probably thinks I'm gonna give him a hummer...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Do you think that's what he wants?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: No. I don't know what he wants. But I know I don't like being watched. Nobody's ever paid any attention to what I did, and I liked it just fine. Where does he get off telling me I disrespect myself?  Fuck him. Look in a mirror, bozo.

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: ...I mean, Doc, the dude is seriously deluded. I said that to him, I said, "If you think I'm gonna do all that shit for you, man, you are seriously deluded."

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What'd he say?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: He said -- "Which we already knew!"

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What did he want you to do?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: First off, he tells me to stop smoking cigarettes. I told him abso-fuckin'- lutely no. As you can see --

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: ...What balls on this guy? What're we...  ...going steady? Jesus.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: No again?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: I said I'd consider it. Nobody owns me. And the last thing was insane. I don't know what's wrong with him... No magazines.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: I don't know if I can quit. We're gonna try it together, like, you know, AA or something. And I made him give up his .22. No more sneaking around the hills with his fucking nut gun like some loony tune.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: He agreed?

turns.speaker: NESSA
turns.text: He's pitiful, Doc, a goddam puppy. I don't know how much longer I can put up with it. I already got two arms and legs, I don't need another appendage.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: You're Doc Mumford.  Skip Skipperton.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Fine. Okay. Pretty good. I've been hoping we'd meet. I've heard a lot about you.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: ..."Find the need and fill it" my dad used to say -- I guess a lot of dads say that -- but I did and it just took off.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: No kidding... Panda. Where'd that come from?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Panda? I've always liked giant pandas... I've been to China and seen them in the wild. That's the kind of thing I can do if I want... now. I can do pretty much anything I want to do these days.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Would you like another beer?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Nah... scotch.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Far out. Single malt?  Can I pick it?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Can I ask you a personal question?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Of course! That's exactly what I want.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Have you thought about getting a wife?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I gotta pee.  Can I ask you something? This town is called Mumford... Been that way since... 18... 18-0... 18-0...  ...thirteen! Right?  Now here's the question -- Your name is Mumford, too.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Is that the question?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: You moved here from back East and your name is the same as this town. Is that right?  Far out.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I hope you don't think I want you to do this for free. Just because we're gonna play it like we're friends, doesn't mean I won't pay you like a doctor.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I have a lot of money. Do you know how much money I've got?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Don't tell me, 'cause I'm not going to tell you what I've got.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I've got three big ones.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I'm impressed. I couldn't make three million dollars if I lived three lifetimes.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: No, no... I have three billion dollars.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: This is great!

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: This is exactly what I wanted.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Skip, you must have lots of people you can throw a ball with.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: You'd be surprised. Most guys have kids or wives or girlfriends. They're busy. It's not as easy as you think.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Skip, you're the head of the whole deal here. Are they busier than you?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Well, you know... that's the thing. Like I said, just about everybody in town works for me. And it's just not the same asking someone to throw a ball when they work for you. It's like an order or something... And no one -- no one -- asks me.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: So, would you say we're out here... let me think how to put this... Is your problem really that you're... lonely?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Don't you like this?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Hell yes, I like it. What's better than this? Most guys would kill just to have someone do this with them whenever they like.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Okay then.  Have you got a lot of friends?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Lily and I talk a bit. You know Lily, runs the coffee shop?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: No... I've seen her. Good-looking woman.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: She's probably ten years older than you.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Good-looking woman.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Lives downstairs from me. She's got a great dog named for Danny Ainge.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Really? I'm the only person I know that likes Danny Ainge, outside of Celtic fans. Maybe Phoenix.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Well, there's Lily.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Did you know that Danny Ainge was drafted by the Blue Jays? Do you know what kind of athlete you have to be to play in the NBA and in the bigs?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Amazing.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Unbelievable...  ...And Lily named her dog after him? Far out.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What kind of person do you have to be to do this?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: This --

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: So I guess Henry Follett is a patient of yours. He's my pharmacist.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Yeah.  Guy's got some serious sex fantasies.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Pretty good, too. Lots of detail. Nothing hard core. Old-fashioned ones, from back when people cared about atmosphere and character.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Problem is, his fantasy life's a lot better than his real one. Nothing can live up to it. His wife got sick of it and left him. Took his kids with her.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I wondered what happened to her...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Hey, Skip.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Doc. I know we're not supposed to get together till Wednesday...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: That's all right. What's on your mind?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: How many sessions have we had now, Doc?  Six. And it's been good... like we were two buddies hanging out. Just shootin' the shit.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I want to tell you something, Doc, but before I do, I need to ask you a question... Because, for me to tell you this thing -- well, I haven't told anybody about this. It's the biggest secret I've got.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Sometimes it's best to keep a few things just for ourselves.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: You're a shrink, Doc. Aren't I supposed to be able to tell you everything?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: It's just a thought.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Hey, maybe that's all right! I don't know all that much about psychology or therapy or... ethics, so maybe there's something I missed... or something...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You're concerned that maybe I can't be trusted with a secret.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I trust you. Definitely. No question. But, yeah, I'm a little concerned. I mean, you're not supposed to tell anyone about your patients' problems... are you?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Yeah, well... what I was gonna tell you --

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: -- Skip. Knowing what you do about me --

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Doc, I trust you! You've listened to me better than anybody... maybe ever.  And this secret I've got, I can't stand it anymore. I don't know if I'm some kind of --

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: All right, I'm just gonna tell you, as simple and direct as I can.  And you understand that this is a big secret? Just between us?  Okay. You know I've got this gift for certain kinds of... machines.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You are Panda, monarch of modems.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: That's right. And you also know that even though I make 23% of the modems in the world... I cannot make one simple connection with any woman who could truly love me.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Okay... let's say that, for now.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: It's true, believe me. So... do you know what I've been doing, all alone, in my workshop, for almost two years?... Mr. Find-the-Need-and-Fill- It. How I spend my every solitary hour?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Guess.  Go ahead, guess!

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Jerking off?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: No!... Although that's a good guess. No, what I've been working on, what the world really needs and no one has been able to create --  -- a virtually life-like, humanoid, gender-specific, anatomically functional... sexual surrogate slash companion.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Slash what?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Sexual surrogate... slash... companion.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: A doll?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: No, Doc, not a doll. I am Panda. I'm talking about much, much more than a doll. The world has never seen what I'm talking about... except maybe in the movies.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: How's it coming?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: You don't think I'm insane?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: And that's your secret?  You meant -- like a trade secret?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: No, Doc, a private secret! It's perverted, it's pitiful. What am I -- Dr. Frankenstein? Aren't you repulsed?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Sounds like kind of a good idea.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Definitely.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Skip, that's not much of a secret.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: It's not?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Oh, it's okay. It's just not something to be ashamed of. Maybe you don't want people knowing -- and believe me, it's safe with me -- but on the scale of dirty little secrets, I'd give it, say... a two.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Who else knows?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Just you.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: It's time you did some talkin', Dr. Mum -- Wait a minute. That is your name, isn't it?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Damn! What is your name?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Doesn't matter. You can call me Doc.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: It matters to me.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I've told you a lot of private stuff.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I can tell you anything else.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: What about everything? How did this happen?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: But there was one job that looked like it might be fun -- Investigator.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Are you telling me your last job before becoming a psychologist was --

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: -- an investigator for the Internal Revenue Service?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Everybody has a story, Skip.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Sounds like you have several.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What it felt like was... a series of separate, unconnected lives -- hillbilly kid, wrecked college boy, garbage man, civil service guy...  ...et cetera... et cetera. Every time I'd leave a life, it felt good. Whatever problems I was having were suddenly gone. I had no friends and I didn't talk to my family. The only constant, stabilizing force in my life was... drugs.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: An IRS investigator with a drug problem?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: It wasn't the best situation.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Did you carry a gun?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Didn't need one. We didn't even need a warrant for most of the shit we did. Man, the IRS... we could go in your bank account, your credit cards... hell, we used to go into doctors' files and get all the juicy details. Nobody wants to argue with the IRS.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Of course, him being insane didn't make it all right that I fell in love with his wife.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Holy shit!

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: "Get to know your therapist."

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: You were messed up, man.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: But look at me now...

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Hey, you've done good. Look at yourself... you've cleaned up, you've got a career --

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: At least you pulled yourself out...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Things got a lot worse.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: You and Candy...?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: And the drugs?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Harder than I thought. Took me three tries. But I was highly motivated -- figured there was no point in leaving me and taking that along. After two bomb-outs, I found a place in the desert...

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Somebody's taking a shower down there.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: That'd be Lily.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I wish I could live in the shower. I'd take five a day if I had the time. I went to this spa in Germany, a sanitarium practically, up on this mountain. And the great thing -- they just kept you wet all day.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Who'd you go with?  That's not good.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: How'd you do it?  The new you.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You know how easy it is. A kid can manage it if he wants a fake I.D. You can do practically the whole deal at your local Kinko's. The only variable is how much pride you take in the product.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I know it starts with a birth certificate...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: All new people start with that...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What about it?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: "Mumford"... I mean, why pick the name of the town you were going to?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Oh. You got it backwards. I already had the name when I started looking for somewhere to settle. When I saw this town on a map, I thought maybe it was a sign. See...

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: And a birth certificate is enough?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Everything flows from that, and what doesn't... can be easily purchased.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: But you studied psychology, right? You did the training and just never got the degree?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: No... no training.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Psych major?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: English Lit.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Jeez, man. But you're good at it!

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I understand what it's like to want to leave a problem behind. That's all most people are looking to do.  Mainly, I listen.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Where ya going? I've got a million questions.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: See you Thursday... regular time.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I've never brought anyone down here before.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I'm honored.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Doc, there's something about what you told me the other night I can't get out of my head. It's driving me batty --  Why me? How did you know you could trust me?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You're completely reliable.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Skip, I've got a problem and I need some advice.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: You want my advice? Far out!

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Pretty creepy, huh? Are you totally disgusted?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Skip, you're a visionary. That can be a burden.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: This doesn't seem a little... perverse?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: There are a lot of lonely people in the world. Somebody's gonna figure this out someday.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: It's not going to be me. I'm giving it up.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: It's all your fault. In the last 48 hours, I've completely lost interest.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What'd I do?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Lily.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Lily...  ...Skip, that's great! You and Lily.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Oh, she doesn't know about it yet. Right now, of the two of us, I'm the only one in love. But I'm very stoked.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Sorry...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Wow.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I'm here for you, Doc.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Skip, you know that it's improper -- completely unethical -- for a licensed psychologist to carry on a romantic relationship with one of his patients?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I guess that makes sense.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Yes, yes it does...

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Doc!... It's not me, is it?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Hmm. I guess that doesn't help... I see where you're going here. It's a mess.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Forgive me, please. What a gracious thought. We must do that.

turns.speaker: SHEELER
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Why don't I call you when I've got my calendar in front of me?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: It's possible. I don't know about that.

turns.speaker: SHEELER
turns.text: I suppose your extended training was at an institution in that area?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Lots of institutions. My graduate advisor believed we should experience as many environments as possible -- prisons, clinics, half-way houses. For a while I was chief therapist in a shopping mall. Had a little spot next to the yogurt place.

turns.speaker: SHEELER
turns.text: I trained in the east, myself -- Cornell -- and I don't care what anyone says, there really are regional differences. I found the state certification exams out here quite harrowing... Did you?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Oh, yeah, very tough. But I guess that's good... to keep out the quacks.

turns.speaker: SHEELER
turns.text: Which examiner did you have? I probably know him.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Wallace Franklin... from Greensburg.

turns.speaker: SHEELER
turns.text: That was a terrible thing.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I don't even know why hang-gliding is considered a legitimate sport.

turns.speaker: SHEELER
turns.text: Yes... your particular approach.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I don't have one really. Most of the time I'm faking it. See, I think there's not much that can be done about most problems... they're too complicated, too deep-rooted by the time I hear about them. The most I can do, usually, is look and listen real closely, try to catch some glimpse of the secret life everybody's got. If I can get a sense of that, well then, maybe... just maybe, I can help them out a little.

turns.speaker: ARDETH RAY
turns.text: I told you to leave or die, you refused, and now you may have killed us all. For you have unleashed the creature that we have feared for more than four thousand years.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Relax, I got him.

turns.speaker: ARDETH RAY
turns.text: No mortal weapons can kill this creature. He is not of this world.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Are we talkin, about the same creature? The walking corpse? Really big mouth? Really bad breath?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: You know where he's taking her?

turns.speaker: ARDETH RAY
turns.text: Yes. To Hamunaptra. To perform the ritual.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Who the hell are these guys?

turns.speaker: ARDETH RAY
turns.text: Priests. Imhotep's priests.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: I never killed a priest before.

turns.speaker: ARDETH RAY
turns.text: They are evil, cursed, they matter not.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Well, okay then.

turns.speaker: ARDETH RAY
turns.text: We saved him! Saved him before the creature could finish his work. Now leave, all of you, quickly, before he finishes you all.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: You're not going to kill us?

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: And what ritual would that be?

turns.speaker: ARDETH RAY
turns.text: The ritual to bring the body of Anck- su-namun back to life.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: And how does one do that?

turns.speaker: ARDETH RAY
turns.text: By reading the Book Of The Dead.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Oh yes, of course.

turns.speaker: ARDETH RAY
turns.text: And then killing your sister.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: ARDETH RAY
turns.text: If he arrives before us, it will be too late.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Did you say 'kill' my sister?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Personally, I would like to surrender. Why can we not just surrender?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Shut-up and gimme your bandolier.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Now go find me a big stick.

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: In the desert? What for?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: How'd a guy like you end up in the Legion anyways?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: I got caught robbing a synagogue. Lots of good stuff in them holy places; churches, temples, mosques, and who's guarding them?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Altar boys?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Exactly! I speak seven languages, including Hebrew, so my specialty was synagogues. How about you? Kill somebody?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: What then? Robbery? Extortion? Kidnapping!

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: None of the above, thank you.

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Then what the hell are you doing here!?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: My very good friend! What a surprise.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Why if it ain't my little buddy, Beni. I oughta kill you.

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: You never were any good with the ladies, O'Connell.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: So you're the one leading the Americans, I shoulda figured. So what's the scam? You get 'em out in the middle of the desert then leave 'em to rot?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Unfortunately no, these Americans are smart, they pay me only half now, half when I get them back to Cairo, so I must go all the way.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: The girl saved my life, figured it was the least I could do, keep her out of trouble.

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: You always did have more balls than brains.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Let's make us even, shall we?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Even?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: O'Connell! I am going to kill you for this!

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Sounds familiar.

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Hey O'Connell! Looks to me like I got all the horses!

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Hey Beni! Looks to me like your on the wrong side of the river!

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Ten to one, O'Connell, your odds are no-so-good.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: I've had worse.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Goin' somewhere?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Just looking for you, O'Connell! I wanted to be with my friend!

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: C'mon, friend.

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Why do you like to fight so much?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: 'Cause I look good doin, it.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Beni ya little stinkweed, where did you slink off to?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: You left me! You left me in the desert to rot.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Oh yeah,... sorry bout that.  So who's this guy?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: This is Prince Imhotep, High Priest of Osiris.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Oh, hey, how ya doin'?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: The Prince does not like to be touched by other humans. A Silly eastern superstition, I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Yeah, well, we all got our little problems today don't we?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: He has come to help Mister Burns. Somehow I feel responsible.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Don't gimme that, you never had any scruples.

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Do you know where I can steal some?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Where's your new friend?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: What friend? You're my only friend.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Then you got no excuse for living. What the hell you doin, being buddies with this creep, Beni? What's in it for you?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: It is better to be the right hand of the Devil,... than in his path. As long as I serve him, I am immune.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Immune from what?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: You shall see.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: What are you looking for? Lie, and I'll slit your throat.

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: The book! The black book they found at Hamunaptra! Imhotep wants it back. Said to me it would be worth it's weight in diamonds.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: What does he want the book for?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Something about bringing his dead girly-friend back to life. He needs the book...  And your sister.

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Like what that Moses guy did to that Pharaoh guy?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: That's one way of putting it.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What just happened?

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: All I remember is him turning into a blast of sand,... and then I remember nothing.

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh yes, always.

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: ...and how do you say? Those slimy things, in your stomach?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Intestines.

turns.speaker: BENI
turns.text: Yeah! Them.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'm sorry, it was an accident.

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: When Ramesses destroyed Syria, it was an accident. You are a catastrophe! Why do I put up with you?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You put up with me, because I can read and write ancient Egyptian, decipher hieroglyphs and hieratic, and I'm the only person within a thousand miles who knows how to properly code and catalogue this library.

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: Who needs smart women? I put up with you because your mother and father were our finest patrons, Allah rest their souls. Now straighten up this mess!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: See the cartouche there, it's the official royal seal of Seti the First, I'm sure of it.

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: Perhaps.

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: Miss Carnavon. Gentlemen.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What is he doing here?

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: Do you truly wish to know? Or would you prefer to just shoot us?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: And you think this justifies killing innocent people!?

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: To have stopped this creature? Yes!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: In the necropolis, when I saw him, - alive,... walking, he called me Anck- su-namun. And then in Mister Burns' quarters he tried to kiss me.

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: It is because it was you who read from the Book. He has chosen you to be the human sacrifice needed to regenerate the body of Anck-su-namun.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'm thinking that if the black Book Of The Dead can bring people back to life --

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: -- then perhaps, the golden Book Of The Living can return them to the underworld.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Exactly --

turns.speaker: HOOK
turns.text: She is like all the others. She will die in the desert.

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: No! She has seen too much. She knows too much.

turns.speaker: HOOK
turns.text: The key!? She has the lost key!?

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: Yes. No one has ever had so much, been so close. We must stop her, or it will be the end of us all.

turns.speaker: HOOK
turns.text: Then we will kill her, we will kill her and all those with her.

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: And burn the map and retrieve the key.

turns.speaker: HOOK
turns.text: It will be done. But what of the American expedition? They leave tomorrow as well.

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: Forget the bumbling Americans, they will be like all the others. Without the map to guide them, how can they possibly find Hamunaptra?
